title: Ephesians Chapter 2 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Ephesians chapter 2 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Ephesians Chapter 2 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Ephesians Chapter 2.

questions.question: According to Ephesians 2:1, what had God done for those who were dead in trespasses and sins?
questions.correctAnswer: He hath quickened them
questions.explanation: Ephesians 2:1 states that God 'hath he quickened, who were dead in trespasses and sins,' meaning He gave life to those spiritually dead.

questions.question: In Ephesians 2:2, according to what did people walk in time past?
questions.correctAnswer: The course of this world
questions.explanation: Ephesians 2:2 mentions that people walked 'according to the course of this world,' following worldly ways before knowing Christ.

questions.question: According to Ephesians 2:3, what are people by nature?
questions.correctAnswer: Children of wrath
questions.explanation: Ephesians 2:3 describes people as being 'by nature the children of wrath,' indicating their natural state without God.

questions.question: What attribute of God is mentioned in Ephesians 2:4 that motivates His actions toward us?
questions.correctAnswer: Rich in mercy
questions.explanation: Ephesians 2:4 highlights that God is 'rich in mercy,' which motivates His loving actions toward humanity.

questions.question: According to Ephesians 2:5, by what means are we saved?
questions.correctAnswer: By grace
questions.explanation: Ephesians 2:5 clearly states salvation is 'by grace ye are saved,' emphasizing unearned favor from God.

questions.question: Where does Ephesians 2:6 say God has made us to sit?
options: In heavenly places in Christ Jesus
questions.correctAnswer: In heavenly places in Christ Jesus
questions.explanation: Ephesians 2:6 says God 'hath raised us up together, and made us sit together in heavenly places in Christ Jesus,' symbolizing our spiritual position.

questions.question: According to Ephesians 2:8, salvation is a gift from whom?
questions.correctAnswer: God
questions.explanation: Ephesians 2:8 states salvation 'is the gift of God,' indicating it is freely given by God and not earned.

questions.question: Why does Ephesians 2:9 say salvation is not of works?
questions.correctAnswer: Lest any man should boast
questions.explanation: Ephesians 2:9 explains salvation is 'not of works, lest any man should boast,' showing it is not earned by human effort.

questions.question: According to Ephesians 2:10, what are we created in Christ Jesus for?
questions.correctAnswer: Good works
questions.explanation: Ephesians 2:10 states we are 'created in Christ Jesus unto good works,' which God prepared for us to do.

questions.question: Who were called 'Uncircumcision' according to Ephesians 2:11?
questions.correctAnswer: Gentiles
questions.explanation: Ephesians 2:11 refers to Gentiles as 'called Uncircumcision' by those called the Circumcision (Jews).

questions.question: True or False: Ephesians 2:12 says that at one time, the Gentiles were without Christ and had no hope.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Ephesians 2:12 states Gentiles 'were without Christ, being aliens... having no hope, and without God in the world,' confirming the statement.

questions.question: According to Ephesians 2:14, who is our peace?
questions.correctAnswer: Christ Jesus
questions.explanation: Ephesians 2:14 declares 'he is our peace,' referring to Christ Jesus who made both Jew and Gentile one.

questions.question: True or False: Ephesians 2:16 says Christ reconciled both to God by the cross.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Ephesians 2:16 states Christ 'might reconcile both unto God in one body by the cross,' confirming the truth of the statement.

questions.question: Fill in the blank from Ephesians 2:18: 'For through him we both have access by one ______ unto the Father.'
questions.correctAnswer: Spirit
questions.explanation: Ephesians 2:18 says 'through him we both have access by one Spirit unto the Father,' indicating the Holy Spirit's role.

questions.question: True or False: Ephesians 2:19 describes believers as strangers and foreigners.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Ephesians 2:19 states believers are 'no more strangers and foreigners, but fellowcitizens with the saints,' so the statement is false.

medium.title: Ephesians Chapter 2 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Ephesians Chapter 2 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with feelings of worthlessness due to past sins. Based on Ephesians 2, what biblical truth would you share about their new identity in Christ?
options: They are made alive together with Christ and saved by grace
They must earn God's favor by good works
They remain children of wrath by nature
They are abandoned because of their past
questions.correctAnswer: They are made alive together with Christ and saved by grace
questions.explanation: Ephesians 2:1-6 teaches that though we were dead in trespasses, God quickened us together with Christ by grace and raised us up, giving us new life and identity.

questions.question: How does Ephesians 2 instruct believers about the role of faith and grace in salvation?
options: Salvation is by grace through faith and is a gift of God
Salvation is earned by human effort and works
Faith alone without grace is enough for salvation
Grace is given only after good works are performed
questions.correctAnswer: Salvation is by grace through faith and is a gift of God
questions.explanation: Ephesians 2:8-9 clearly states that salvation comes by grace through faith and is not from ourselves or works, so no one can boast.

questions.question: A believer is feeling uncertain about their purpose. According to Ephesians 2, what practical truth about God’s plan for them would you share?
options: They are God’s workmanship, created for good works ordained beforehand
Their purpose is undefined and left to personal choice
They must create their own meaning through achievements
Their value depends on how others view them
questions.correctAnswer: They are God’s workmanship, created for good works ordained beforehand
questions.explanation: Ephesians 2:10 states believers are God's workmanship, created in Christ Jesus to do good works which God prepared in advance for us to walk in.

questions.question: What does Ephesians 2 teach about the unity between Jews and Gentiles in the church?
options: Christ has broken down the dividing wall and made one new man
Gentiles remain strangers and separate from Israel
The law keeps Jews and Gentiles apart permanently
Gentiles are excluded from the promises of God
questions.correctAnswer: Christ has broken down the dividing wall and made one new man
questions.explanation: Verses 14-15 explain Christ abolished enmity by breaking down the partition and making one new man from the two, bringing peace.

questions.question: A believer is discouraged by conflicts within their church community. Based on Ephesians 2, what would you advise about maintaining peace and unity?
options: Remember Christ is our peace who reconciles us into one body
Avoid all fellowship with others to prevent conflict
Trust in your own wisdom to solve disputes
Focus on differences rather than common faith
questions.correctAnswer: Remember Christ is our peace who reconciles us into one body
questions.explanation: Ephesians 2:14-16 teaches that Christ is our peace, reconciling us both to God and to one another in one body through the cross.

questions.question: How does Ephesians 2 guide believers to view their relationship with God and the church?
options: As fellow citizens with the saints and members of God’s household
As outsiders without a place in God’s plan
As temporary guests in God’s kingdom
questions.correctAnswer: As fellow citizens with the saints and members of God’s household
questions.explanation: Ephesians 2:19 states believers are no longer strangers but fellow citizens and members of God’s household.

questions.question: According to Ephesians 2, what is the foundation upon which the church is built?
options: The apostles and prophets, with Jesus Christ as the cornerstone
questions.correctAnswer: The apostles and prophets, with Jesus Christ as the cornerstone
questions.explanation: Ephesians 2:20 teaches the church is built on the foundation of apostles and prophets, with Jesus Christ himself as the chief cornerstone.

questions.question: A believer is tempted to rely on their own works for acceptance before God. Based on Ephesians 2, what biblical truth counters this temptation?
options: Salvation is not from works so no one may boast
Works are the main way to earn God’s favor
God accepts people based on their achievements
questions.correctAnswer: Salvation is not from works so no one may boast
questions.explanation: Ephesians 2:9 explains that salvation is not by works, so no one can boast, emphasizing grace alone.

questions.question: How does Ephesians 2 encourage believers to approach good works in daily life?
options: Good works are the fruit of being created in Christ and ordained by God
Good works earn God’s love and salvation
Good works are optional and unrelated to faith
Good works are only for church leaders
questions.correctAnswer: Good works are the fruit of being created in Christ and ordained by God
questions.explanation: Ephesians 2:10 shows believers are created in Christ to do good works which God prepared beforehand for us to walk in.

questions.question: A believer is feeling distant from God and others. According to Ephesians 2, what hope can you share about their relationship through Christ?
options: Those once far off are made near by the blood of Christ
Only certain people can be near to God
Distance cannot be overcome by faith
questions.correctAnswer: Those once far off are made near by the blood of Christ
questions.explanation: Ephesians 2:13 teaches that those who were far off are now made near by the blood of Christ, offering hope of reconciliation.

questions.question: How does Ephesians 2 describe the role of the Spirit in a believer's access to God?
options: Through Christ both Jews and Gentiles have access to the Father by one Spirit
Access to God is limited to a select few
The Spirit does not play a part in access to God
questions.correctAnswer: Through Christ both Jews and Gentiles have access to the Father by one Spirit
questions.explanation: Ephesians 2:18 states that through Christ, both groups have access to the Father by one Spirit, highlighting unity and prayer life.

questions.question: True or False: According to Ephesians 2, salvation is a result of human effort and personal achievement.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Ephesians 2:8-9 clearly states salvation is by grace through faith and not by works, so it is not a result of human effort.

questions.question: True or False: Ephesians 2 teaches that believers should live as strangers and foreigners without fellowship in the household of God.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Ephesians 2:19 instructs that believers are no longer strangers but fellow citizens and members of the household of God, emphasizing community and fellowship.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Ephesians 2 teaches that believers are built together for an ______ of God through the Spirit.
questions.correctAnswer: habitation
questions.explanation: Ephesians 2:22 states believers are built together for a habitation of God through the Spirit, highlighting the indwelling presence of God in the church.

questions.question: How does Ephesians 2 instruct believers to view their past lifestyle before Christ?
options: They were dead in trespasses and sins fulfilling the desires of the flesh
They were perfect and without fault
They were already children of God by nature
They had no need for salvation
questions.correctAnswer: They were dead in trespasses and sins fulfilling the desires of the flesh
questions.explanation: Ephesians 2:1-3 describes the past condition as being dead in sins and living according to the flesh and worldly ways before God’s mercy intervened.

hard.title: Ephesians Chapter 2 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Ephesians Chapter 2.

questions.question: According to Ephesians 2:1, what condition were the readers in before God quickened them?
questions.correctAnswer: Dead in trespasses and sins
questions.explanation: Ephesians 2:1 explicitly states that the readers were 'dead in trespasses and sins' before God quickened them.

questions.question: Ephesians 2:2 refers to the 'prince of the power of the air.' Who or what is this figure commonly understood to represent in biblical theology?
questions.correctAnswer: Satan or the devil
questions.explanation: The phrase 'prince of the power of the air' in Ephesians 2:2 is commonly interpreted as referring to Satan, who exercises influence over the world.

questions.question: Ephesians 2:3 uses the term 'children of wrath.' What Old Testament concept does this phrase parallel?
questions.correctAnswer: Children of disobedience
questions.explanation: The phrase 'children of wrath' in Ephesians 2:3 aligns with the idea of being 'children of disobedience,' highlighting humanity’s sinful state before salvation.

questions.question: What attribute of God is emphasized in Ephesians 2:4 as the reason for salvation despite human deadness?
questions.correctAnswer: Rich in mercy
questions.explanation: Ephesians 2:4 highlights God's richness in mercy as the motivating factor for loving and quickening believers despite their sins.

questions.question: Fill in the blank from Ephesians 2:5: 'Even when we were dead in sins, hath quickened us together with Christ, (by ______ ye are saved;)'
questions.correctAnswer: grace
questions.explanation: Ephesians 2:5 states explicitly that salvation is by grace: 'by grace ye are saved.'

questions.question: Ephesians 2:6 speaks of believers being raised up and made to sit where?
options: In heavenly places in Christ Jesus
On the earth among the nations
At the right hand of Moses
questions.correctAnswer: In heavenly places in Christ Jesus
questions.explanation: The verse describes believers as raised and seated in heavenly places with Christ, symbolizing spiritual authority and union with Him.

questions.question: According to Ephesians 2:7, what is the purpose of God showing the exceeding riches of His grace?
options: To display kindness toward us through Christ Jesus
questions.correctAnswer: To display kindness toward us through Christ Jesus
questions.explanation: Ephesians 2:7 explains that God's grace is shown to demonstrate His kindness toward believers through Christ.

questions.question: What is the theological significance of the phrase 'For by grace are ye saved through faith; and that not of yourselves: it is the gift of God' in Ephesians 2:8?
options: Salvation is entirely a divine gift, not human achievement
Faith is earned by good works
Grace is a result of human effort
Salvation depends on adherence to the law
questions.correctAnswer: Salvation is entirely a divine gift, not human achievement
questions.explanation: Ephesians 2:8 emphasizes that salvation is a gift from God, received through faith, not by human works or effort.

questions.question: True or False: According to Ephesians 2:9, works are the basis for boasting in salvation.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Ephesians 2:9 clearly states that salvation is 'Not of works, lest any man should boast,' negating boasting based on works.

questions.question: Ephesians 2:10 describes believers as God's workmanship. What is the purpose given for this creation?
options: Created unto good works which God prepared beforehand
Created to follow the law strictly
questions.correctAnswer: Created unto good works which God prepared beforehand
questions.explanation: The verse states believers are created in Christ Jesus to perform good works ordained by God.

questions.question: In Ephesians 2:11-12, Gentiles are described as being called 'Uncircumcision' by those called 'Circumcision.' What does this cultural distinction highlight historically?
options: The division between Jews and Gentiles
The unity of all peoples under one law
The role of kings in the early church
questions.correctAnswer: The division between Jews and Gentiles
questions.explanation: These verses highlight the ethnic and religious division between Jewish believers and Gentiles in the first-century context.

questions.question: Ephesians 2:13 states those who were far off are made nigh by what means?
questions.correctAnswer: The blood of Christ
questions.explanation: This verse explicitly affirms that reconciliation and nearness to God come through the blood of Christ.

questions.question: What is symbolized by Christ breaking down 'the middle wall of partition' in Ephesians 2:14?
options: The removal of hostility between Jews and Gentiles
The separation between heaven and earth
questions.correctAnswer: The removal of hostility between Jews and Gentiles
questions.explanation: The 'middle wall of partition' refers to the barrier dividing Jews and Gentiles; Christ abolished this to create peace.

questions.question: Ephesians 2:15-16 discusses Christ abolishing the law of commandments contained in ordinances. What is the purpose of this abolition?
options: To make one new man and reconcile both to God through the cross
To establish a new legal code
To separate the church from Israel
questions.correctAnswer: To make one new man and reconcile both to God through the cross
questions.explanation: These verses show Christ's purpose was to unify Jews and Gentiles into one new humanity and reconcile them to God.

questions.question: According to Ephesians 2:18, through whom do believers have access to the Father?
questions.correctAnswer: One Spirit
questions.explanation: The passage underscores that access to God the Father is granted through the one Spirit, uniting believers.

theological.title: Ephesians Chapter 2 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Ephesians Chapter 2 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to Ephesians 2, what condition were believers in before God quickened them?
questions.correctAnswer: Dead in trespasses and sins
questions.explanation: Ephesians 2:1 states believers were 'dead in trespasses and sins' before God quickened them. This aligns with Romans 5:12 on the universality of sin, Genesis 2:17 concerning death due to sin, and John 5:24 regarding receiving life through Christ.

questions.question: Who is described as the 'prince of the power of the air' influencing those disobedient?
options: The spirit that now worketh in the children of disobedience
questions.correctAnswer: The spirit that now worketh in the children of disobedience
questions.explanation: Ephesians 2:2 identifies this 'prince of the power of the air' as the spirit influencing disobedient children. This reflects 2 Corinthians 4:4 about the god of this world blinding minds, and John 14:30 where Satan is called the prince of this world.

questions.question: What phrase does Ephesians 2:3 use to describe humanity’s natural state before salvation?
questions.correctAnswer: Children of wrath
questions.explanation: Ephesians 2:3 says humans were 'children of wrath' by nature. This corresponds with Psalm 51:5 on sin nature, Romans 3:23 on universal sinfulness, and John 3:36 on wrath abiding on the unbeliever.

questions.question: How is God's love described in relation to our salvation?
options: Rich in mercy and great in love
questions.correctAnswer: Rich in mercy and great in love
questions.explanation: Ephesians 2:4 highlights God's mercy and great love as the basis for salvation. This is consistent with Titus 3:5 on God's mercy, 1 John 4:8 on God as love, and Psalm 103:8 describing God's merciful nature.

questions.question: Salvation is given by grace through what means?
questions.correctAnswer: Faith
questions.explanation: Ephesians 2:8 teaches salvation is by grace through faith, not works. This agrees with Romans 3:28, Galatians 2:16, and John 3:16 emphasizing faith as the means to receive grace.

questions.question: Why does Ephesians 2:9 emphasize that salvation is not by works?
options: So that no one can boast
questions.correctAnswer: So that no one can boast
questions.explanation: Ephesians 2:9 explains salvation is not by works to prevent boasting. This is supported by Romans 4:2-3 on Abraham’s faith, 1 Corinthians 1:29 on boasting excluded, and Jeremiah 9:23-24 contrasting boasting in God.

questions.question: What are believers described as in Ephesians 2:10, indicating their purpose after salvation?
options: His workmanship created unto good works
Merely recipients of grace without purpose
questions.correctAnswer: His workmanship created unto good works
questions.explanation: Ephesians 2:10 describes believers as God’s workmanship created for good works, aligning with Colossians 1:16 on purpose in Christ, Philippians 2:13 on God working in believers, and Titus 2:14 on sanctification for good works.

questions.question: Before salvation, what were the Gentiles described as in relation to Israel?
options: Aliens from the commonwealth of Israel
questions.correctAnswer: Aliens from the commonwealth of Israel
questions.explanation: Ephesians 2:12 calls Gentiles 'aliens from the commonwealth of Israel', emphasizing their separation before Christ. This is consistent with Romans 11:17-24 on Gentiles grafted in, and Galatians 3:28 on unity in Christ.

questions.question: By what means does Ephesians 2:13 say those who were far off are made near?
questions.correctAnswer: By the blood of Christ
questions.explanation: Ephesians 2:13 states those far off are made near through Christ's blood, reflecting Hebrews 9:22 on blood for remission, Romans 5:9 on justification by His blood, and 1 John 1:7 on cleansing by Jesus’ blood.

questions.question: What has Christ abolished to create one new man and make peace?
options: The enmity, the law of commandments contained in ordinances
questions.correctAnswer: The enmity, the law of commandments contained in ordinances
questions.explanation: Ephesians 2:15 teaches Christ abolished the enmity and law of commandments in ordinances to unite Jews and Gentiles. This corresponds with Colossians 2:14 on blotting out ordinances, and Galatians 3:28 on one in Christ.

questions.question: Through what means does Ephesians 2:18 say both Jews and Gentiles have access to the Father?
questions.correctAnswer: By one Spirit
questions.explanation: Ephesians 2:18 states access to the Father is through one Spirit, consistent with John 14:6 on Jesus as the way, Romans 8:9 on living by the Spirit, and Hebrews 10:19 on access through the Spirit.

questions.question: What new identity do believers receive according to Ephesians 2:19?
options: Fellowcitizens with the saints and of the household of God
questions.correctAnswer: Fellowcitizens with the saints and of the household of God
questions.explanation: Ephesians 2:19 declares believers are no longer strangers but fellowcitizens and family in God’s household, aligning with Galatians 3:28 on unity, Romans 8:17 on heirs with Christ, and 1 Peter 2:9 on royal priesthood identity.

questions.question: What is the foundation of the household of God as explained in Ephesians 2:20?
options: The apostles and prophets, Jesus Christ the chief cornerstone
The law and the prophets alone
questions.correctAnswer: The apostles and prophets, Jesus Christ the chief cornerstone
questions.explanation: Ephesians 2:20 describes the foundation as apostles and prophets with Christ as the chief cornerstone, consistent with 1 Corinthians 3:11, Psalm 118:22 on the cornerstone, and Matthew 16:18 identifying Christ as the rock.

questions.question: What does the building fitly framed together in Christ become, according to Ephesians 2:21?
options: An holy temple in the Lord
questions.correctAnswer: An holy temple in the Lord
questions.explanation: Ephesians 2:21 speaks of the building growing into a holy temple in the Lord, paralleling 1 Corinthians 3:16 on believers as God’s temple, Psalm 27:4 on dwelling in God’s house, and 1 Peter 2:5 on believers as living stones.

questions.question: For what purpose are believers builded together in Christ according to Ephesians 2:22?
options: For an habitation of God through the Spirit
questions.correctAnswer: For an habitation of God through the Spirit
questions.explanation: Ephesians 2:22 states believers are built together for God's habitation through the Spirit, consistent with John 14:17 on the Spirit indwelling, 1 Corinthians 6:19 on the body as the Spirit’s temple, and Colossians 1:27 on Christ in believers.
